meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ancient.
meanings.sent1: The ancientnesses of the artifacts in the museum fascinated the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The ancientnesses of the pyramids in Egypt attract tourists from all over the world.
meanings.sent3: The ancientnesses of the history books made the students yawn in class.
meanings.sent4: The ancientnesses of the trees in the forest whispered stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The ancientnesses of the fossils in the ground revealed secrets of long ago.

meanings.definition: The ancient character or style of something.
meanings.sent1: The ancientnesses of the architecture in Rome reflect its rich history.
meanings.sent2: The ancientnesses of the pottery displayed intricate designs from centuries ago.
meanings.sent3: The ancientnesses of the old carriages in the museum seemed to transport visitors back in time.
meanings.sent4: The ancientnesses of the traditions were preserved through generations.
meanings.sent5: The ancientnesses of the language in the text revealed its origins.

meanings.definition: The ancientnesses of the ruins were evident in their crumbling structures.
meanings.sent1: The ancientnesses of the ruins captured the imagination of the explorers.
meanings.sent2: The ancientnesses of the ruins hinted at a lost civilization.
meanings.sent3: The ancientnesses of the ruins made the archaeologists excited to uncover their secrets.
meanings.sent4: The ancientnesses of the ruins echoed with the whispers of the past.
meanings.sent5: The ancientnesses of the ruins painted a picture of bygone eras.
